alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 12:10PM EST until March 04 at 3:24AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River at Terre Haute, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Montezuma, Covington, and Lafayette. .Rainfall amounts of one and a half to over three inches earlier last week brought lowland flooding to the Wabash River. With more precipitation in the forecast over the next few days these conditions could persist into the middle of next week or longer in some locations. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, A few county roads begin to flood. Higher bottomlands begin to flood. The first cottage upstream from U.S. 136 bridge may become isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EST Sunday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 17.2 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then rise to 19.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will stay near to above flood stage throughout the week. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
